intro: Cullen pallidum, commonly known as the pale cullen, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Cullen pallidum is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
